intro: Seseli floribundum, commonly known as the clustered seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late spring to early summer. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
